intro: Secamone pulchra subsp. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved secamone, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom during the wet season. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species in horticulture.
